content.question: Hydrangea macrophylla is a species of plant with blue or pink flowers. Flower color in Hydrangea macrophylla plants is thought to be determined primarily by soil conditions rather than by inherited differences. Which of the following will provide the most direct evidence that flower color in Hydrangea macrophylla is due primarily to soil conditions?

choices.label: Comparing DNA sequence information for Hydrangea macrophylla to DNA sequence information for a different species of flowering plant
Performing a genetic cross between a pink-flowered plant and a blue-flowered plant and then determining the ratio of phenotypes in the offspring
Growing cuttings from the same Hydrangea macrophylla plant under controlled conditions that vary only with regard to soil pH
Analyzing fossilized remains of an ancestral species that grew in geographic areas similar to the habitats of modern Hydrangea macrophylla

content.answer: Growing cuttings from the same Hydrangea macrophylla plant under controlled conditions that vary only with regard to soil pH

skill.text: 3.A: Identify or pose a testable question based on an observation, data, or a model.
